page.title: 11NEW RESIDENTS IN QUARRINGTON
page.content: Wednesday 3 April l985 was the day we, Hilda and Con Webster, took up {residence}in{Quarrington.}For l6 years we had lived on Merseyside, the latter 9 years of this period being spent in a flat. It took three hours to unload our household belongings into a modern, 3 bedroomed, detached bungalow, on a small, pleasant, {recently developed estate}of 2, 3 and 4 bedroomed open plan bungalows. The gardens and properties are well maintained by the residents, who seem to be mainly in the 45 plus age group. These people are friendly but not intrusive. {Quarrington}has a church, a farm, a riding school and approximately a dozen other residences but there is no shop or public house. As{Sleaford}is only l mile away the absence of a shop in the village causes no inconvenience.
